item.title: Authorization v1.x
item.description:
1. Docker Hub images are discontinued. All deployments will be using images from quay.io.

  2. As of Container Storage Modules v1.15, Authorization v1.x will not be supported. Please migrate to Authorization v2.0 using the following guide.

Container Storage Modules Authorization can be installed by using the provided Helm v3 charts on Kubernetes platforms.

The following Container Storage Modules Authorization components are installed in the specified namespace:

  • proxy-service, which forwards requests from the CSI Driver to the backend storage array
  • tenant-service, which configures tenants, role bindings, and generates JSON Web Tokens
  • role-service, which configures roles for tenants to be bound to
  • storage-service, which configures backend storage arrays for the proxy-server to forward requests to

The following third-party components are installed in the specified namespace:

item.title: Resiliency
item.description:
Docker Hub images are discontinued. All deployments will be using images from quay.io.

CSM for Resiliency is installed as part of the Dell CSI driver installation.

For information on the PowerStore CSI driver, see PowerMax CSI Driver.

Prerequisite

  • The CSM for Resiliency module only acts on pods with a specific label.
  • This label must match the key and value set in the moduleâ€™s configuration.
  • On startup, CSM for Resiliency logs the label key and value it uses to monitor pods.
  • Apply this label to the Statefulset you want monitored by CSM for Resiliency.
labelSelector: {map[podmon.dellemc.com/driver:csi-<driver>]}
